author: ATTKippy
body: Why would TBP follow APH? They're neither an LP, nor have a major stake (Apha has 7% now?). They're a pharma company with a long turnaround time on trials that we have a (rough) estimate on where and when they'll be completed. If TBP pulls through and it's not all smoke and mirrors like some people mention on this sub with every NR, then momentum realized through legalization will seem like peanuts. If its a crapshoot, well, you lost whatever you put in.

Absolutely. The federal illegality is contributing to investment news sources being reluctant to publicize American tickers. It doesn’t look great when you are pushing OTC names. author: TimeBlindAdderall
body: Caveat - recreational investor here.  I will stay away from Canadian weed stocks for the long haul. I cashed out CRIN and TLRY for a profit, and then held OGI, HEXO, ACB and APH way into the red like an idiot. The Canadian business model is not doing great in that, the majority of recreational and medical users up there prefer street weed (flower) or to just grow their own.  There is no reason to pay the high prices for store bought weed and no enforced penalties when they roll their own.  For edibles and oils, concentrates, et al, they still go to the stores, but those trips are few and far between.  Many US states that decriminalized cannabis seem to have recriminalized it in a different fashion, to direct people to the licensed distributors.  It is my personal belief, not supported by any evidence that I’ve seen, that at some point, States or the Feds are going to start slapping Tax Evasion charges on the unlicensed growers and sellers to bring them into compliance.  For those reasons, GTBIF, CRLBF, CURLF, TCNNF, and similar are the best long term holds.  I am also long on a lot of the penny stocks that crashed last year and have stayed below a dollar.
